It's not Thunderbird storage. It's your e-mail service provider.

You could also move messages from server folders to local folders.

content: First, disable account hub in Settings/General, then accept cookies in TB Settings/Privacy & Security, disable VPN if in use, and add the account from ⩸ - New Account - Email. Omit the password until after the account is added and enter it in the OAuth2 authentication window at first opening of the Inbox.

content:

I have installed Linux TB on the Chromebook with no apparent issues. This version has no "Account Hub" or "Account Wizard", nor option to enable/disable.

"Create a new account" on the Chromebook opens a page entitled "Set up your existing email address." Required fields are "Your Ful Name", "Email address" and "Password".

I don't know anything about a TB password but enter one anyway so I can click "continue" to the next page, where it's announced that TB has successfully found my existing Gmail server configuration. It looks OK so I click "Done", then a dialog box appears that says, "Checking password", along with some animated dancing dots.

Hours later, TB is still "checking password" until I stop the operation and start over, only to have the same result. It seems a critical factor is the password I don't have. Where does one find that? I tried typing in the one saved in the TB Password Manager on my PC but that didn't work either.

Possibly some "syncing" issue with my existing account? It can't be this difficult!

content:
Lay Jeme said
I enabled passwordless mode in Outlook, authenticating via the authenticator app. When adding my Outlook account to Thunderbird, after passing the authenticator verification, I was then prompted to enter my email account password. However, my account no longer has a password. When I disabled the authenticator and switched to password mode, Thunderbird displayed a "Verification failed. Please check your username and password" error after I entered the password. On a previous occasion whilst adding an email account, the interface suddenly froze. The loading icon ⭕ kept spinning indefinitely, and after waiting a considerable time with no response, I forcibly closed Thunderbird. Subsequently, when attempting to add the email account to Thunderbird again, the aforementioned error occurred.

Disable account hub in Settings/General, then add the account from ⩸ - New Account - Email. Do not enter the password at this point, but only after the account has been added and the OAuth2 authentication window appears on first opening of the Inbox.

content: When this happens, it is usually for one of two possibilities: either the setup is incorrect, or the password is wrong. If the setup is incorrect, someone here may have suggestions. If the password is wrong, you need to contact your email provider.

content: The problem is that it is the email provider making that request, not Thunderbird. That could be an incorrect account setting, or that you need a new password.

content: ALL email accounts require passwords, including Orange. Depending on the email provider's policies, you may be able to use the password stored on old computer. click settings>privacy&security and click the saved passwords button and then the show passwords button. Prior to displaying that, thunderbird may prompt for your Windows login PIN (assuming you use Windows).

creator: Toad-Hall

content:
It's possible it indicates that a policy has been set, usually by security software like antivirus or a system administrator.

I've seen reports of a similar Settings message but that was "Your browser is being managed by your organisation". So that would be in Firefox browser not Thunderbird. It's not something I've seen in Thunderbird - but there's always a first time :)

I would start by checking to see if you have updater software which is controlling when updates are forced on Thunderbird. That updater software may be a program you installed OR is something being offered and controlled by your Anti-Virus software. for example : I have noticed that AV Norton can check for updates for programs. I would advise that you do not allow updater software programs to control when updates occur in Thunderbird. Only let Thunderbird look for updates as it will only offer the correct ones.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
I have a registry hack that can disable and enable Thunderbird checking for updates. When checking is disabled, the About screen shows, "Updates disabled by your system administrator."

I have a similar hack for Firefox, which produces a similar notice.

content:
There are a few ways of managing the Font size in Thunderbird.

If you need the general UI to increase Font Size - that means Folder Pane, Message List, Menus etc Click on the Menu app icon (3 lines) For 'Font Size' click on the + icon to increase font size - repeat until the view is good for you.

You can also control the Font Size for incoming mail and emails you compose. You may prefer them to be larger than the general UI size OR you may prefer to force a minimum Font Size as some can be too small. If you want to set this up so you do not have to zoom all the time then here is what you do: I've added some images below as a guide.

In Thunderbird

  • Settings > General
  • scroll down to 'Language & Fonts'
  • Click on 'Advanced' button

I'm suggesting font size 16 as normal size and 14 as minimum, but you can choose a larger size if required.

  • Fonts for: select 'Latin' from dropdown list
  • Proportional: Sans Serif: Size: set prefered size eg: 16
  • Monospaced: Consolas: Size: Set same size : eg: 16
  • Minimum font size: Set eg: 14 (this forces the smallest text to use 14) Do not set this minimum font size greater than you set for 'Proportional'.
  • uncheck - 'Allow messages to use other fonts'

Now set up the following:

  • Fonts for: select 'Other Writing Systems' from the drop down list - it's usually at the bottom
  • Set identical sizes as you set for the 'Latin' - as shown above.

Then click on 'OK'

Check you have the following:

  • Settings > Composition
  • under 'HTML Style'
  • Use the following:
  • Font : Variable Width Size: Medium

That 'medium' means to use what you set up previously for 'Proportional', so using example offered above - for you Medium would mean eg:16. Please note, it's not hard coded into emails, so the recipient is not forced to use what you set.

Reselect a different email to force the settings to display using new Font Size.

Alternative: IF you think everything really is ok then you can use 'Zoom'.

  • Select the email in list to open it, so you can see it in the Message Pane. You must have focus on that opened email content.
  • You can the 'Menu Bar' toolbar : 'View' > 'Zoom' > click on 'Zoom in' to enlarge

Or you use the keyboard as it's more convenient:

  • to increase/zoom: 'Ctrl'+'+' repeat pressing the + until suitable zoom
  • to decrease size  : 'Ctrl' + '-'
  • Reset back to original: 'Ctrl'+'0' (thats a zero)
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
david said
Either post your issue in English, or summarize the issue with fewer words. I use the Bing Translator and your post was too big to be properly translated. Thank you.

English version

Hello. I need help with Problem. In my organization we have 13 boxes that installed on the 50 users' computers with POP3 protocol

Due to the fact that the local e-mail provider suddenly initiated a changing passwords of our email boxes in my organization, when he suddenly did it, after I have these two problems:

1. Immediately all Thunderbird clients lose access to the server, trying to contact with old credentials and it accompanied with appearing every 10-60 seconds (it seems to me that 10-30 seconds) new window - an error that is the subject of the issue "Error entry into the server <server> named user <user name>". That is, at that time, whean I (the system administrator) will come to the user where client is installed and enter a new password on his screen, i see that appears many of thtis error windows and accumulate if I go for hours to him (tens of hundreds of windows while the computer is turned on), and this can stuck old computers btw, and I have to first kill the process 'thinderbird.exe' in the tasks manager for just reenter New password!. That strange behavior is not normal I think that every 30 sec appear error window! - This is the main message. In my opinion, only One window would be enough that authorization is impossible.

2. The problem is very serious. It follows from clause 1, namely, because of hundreds of requests for the server with an attempt to authorize with incorrect old passwords, until I have yet managed to enter their users, The provider blocks our IP address of the entire organization and adds it to the black list (from his words), thay sad me that server have “rule of blocking: 10 unsuccessful authorize attempts - send us to the black list on server”. With this error of authorization, it manifests itself with renewed vigor. After dialog with the provider, they sad me that thay put our IP-address in their exception list from black list, and its blocking will not be possible. But in fact, nothing has changed even after I entered new passwords data on all 50 computers of the organization where TB clients installed (for POP3/SMTP protocols in the password storage). The problem is that an error now appears randomly in everyone PC: Usually from 1 to 10 windows during a day. It all Seems as if clients are also trying to log in with incorrect old passwords, and we again get into a black list - blocking - error.

I think that not only provider can be to blame, but my clients too (this is the latest version of ESR). How my clients was installed as follows: a) Installation and complete setting once on my computer with the settings that I want for everyone Installation of a client (user) of a pure ESR from an official site (a year ago was not the same) b) Editing Prefs.js in eplacing all inclusions from my email adress to desired address, mail server, replaced of mail.identity.id1.fullname, and such others. That is, a Painfully designed file for each individual PC. c) deleted the logins.json file , because I knows that this contains an old password 100%.

This is all that I did to change the old credentials for new in boxes of each PC, and thus is pre -designed in advance and deployed according by this instruction - worked everywhere for several years until then, Until the provider decided to replace the passwords for us.

Today I understand that in the user profile remain in Roaming\Thunderbird there are still many files/folders that need to be deleted/replaced/changed before unfolding them on users PC. Thus, my assumption and question: where I could cancel and forget to do that? In which files an “old” accounting data can be stored? (due to which we have an random error I think). If you tell me, I delete/change all files that need it and, for example, re-authorize manually on each PC and thereby leave only new details in the storage. I assume that the following files may have meaning: Foldercache.json foldertree.json Session.json parent.lock pkcs11.txt cert9.db key4.db logins.json times.json Maybe there are other files, databases from where the old authorization can come? because of which we gets an error with wrong credentials and come to the blacklist of the provider.

If I wrong, and with TB all right, then there are no questions for support, and I will only write to the provider. The photo shows 1- many superimposed windows on each other that appears on all TB clients after they changed password; 2- random eroor after entering the correct password into the box (appears on all cleints 1-10 times during a day)
creator: alexei.bat

content: At the moment, I installed a clean client of an ordinary non -ESR, and connected one of the email box POP3 with which my colleagues have an error , and I will observe a error within a day. And it may appear regardless of my client, since the error can cause any on colleagues computers and the server will block all of us.
